title: Aberdeen police officer involved in shooting, DCI investigating
content:
An Aberdeen police officer was involved in a shooting early Sunday, Attorney General Marty Jackley confirmed.
Aberdeen Police responded to a disturbance call at 12:10 a.m. Sunday at 324 Marshall Street that resulted in an officer firing the gun at a man, according to a statement from the attorney general's office.
The man has been identified as Ehkhu Hser Poe, 21, of Aberdeen. Poe was transported to a hospital and was being treated for his injuries. The extent of his injuries was not released.
The South Dakota Division of Criminal Investigation is investigating and will submit a case report to the Attorney General and States Attorney to review and determine the officer's action, according to the statement.
The summary is expected to be released within 30 days.
